member.summary: Gets or sets the button text or the command link's command text.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether the elevation icon is displayed.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpItem
member.summary: Represents an item in the Jump List (either or ).

member.summary: Gets the owner .

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpItem.CustomCategory
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the category the is grouped with in the Jump List.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpLink
member.summary: Represents a shortcut to an application in the Windows 7 taskbar Jump List.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpLink.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a .

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpLink.ApplicationPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the application.
member.remarks: If the ApplicationPath property is not specified, then the path of the current running process is implied. An application can contain links for executables other than itself.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpLink.ShowCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the show command for a Shell link object.
member.remarks: The show command sets the initial show state of the window.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpLink.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the working directory of the application on startup.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpLink.Arguments
member.summary: Gets or sets the arguments passed to the application on startup.
member.remarks: Adding links with no arguments is not supported by Shell.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpLink.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed for the link in the Jump List.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpLink.Tooltip
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom tooltip for the link in the Jump List.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpLink.IconPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to a resource that contains the icon to display in the Jump List.
member.remarks: An empty path references the executable file that started the application.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpLink.IconIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the zero-based index of an icon embedded in a resource.
member.remarks: If no icon resource is specified, or if the specified icon is not found, the standard system icon is displayed.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList
member.summary: Represents a list of items and tasks displayed as a menu on a Windows 7 taskbar button.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.AddToRecentCategory(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified file path to the Recent category of the Jump List.
member.remarks: The contents of the Recent category are managed by the Windows shell. If your application is not registered to handle the file type of the item, it will not appear in the Recent list and calls to AddToRecentCategory(String) will fail silently.
member.param: The path to add to the Jump List.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.AddToRecentCategory(C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpItem)
member.summary: Adds the specified or to the Recent category of the Jump List.
member.remarks: The contents of the Recent category are managed by the Windows shell. If your application is not registered to handle the file type of the item, it will not appear in the Recent list and calls to AddToRecentCategory(C1JumpPath) will fail silently.
member.param: The or to add to the Jump List.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.GetKnownCategoryItems(C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.JumpListKnownCategory)
member.summary: Retrieves the destinations listed in the Recent or Frequent category in a Jump List.
member.remarks: If a user pins an item in the Recent or Frequent categories, the item is no longer shown in its original category to avoid duplication in the Jump List. However, the item will still be returned by this method.
member.param: Specifies from which category the list of destinations should be retrieved.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.RemoveFromKnownCategories(C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpItem)
member.summary: Removes a single or from the Recent and Frequent categories in a Jump List.
member.remarks: If the item is pinned to the list by the user, it is not removed but its usage data is cleared.
member.param: The or that represents the destination to remove.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.ClearKnownCategories
member.summary: Clears all destination entries from the Recent and Frequent categories in an application's Jump List.
member.remarks: This method does not remove items that the user has pinned to the Jump List. Those items cannot be removed programmatically; only the user can remove them. However, it does remove usage data for those pinned items.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.ClearTasksAndCustomCategories
member.summary: Deletes a custom Jump List for the current application.
member.remarks: This method should not be called when an application is updating a custom destination list. It is used only to completely clear the list during an uninstall operation, or if the application provides an option for the user to turn off the list.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.Apply
member.summary: Applies the pending Jump List changes and refreshes the taskbar.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.Owner
member.summary: Gets the owner .

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.MaxSlots
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of items that will be shown in the Jump List.
member.remarks: The returned value corresponds to the "Number of recent items to display in Jump Lists" option in the "Taskbar and Start Menu Properties" - "Customize Start Menu" window. More items can be added to the collection, but they will not be shown in the UI.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.Modified
member.summary: Gets the value that indicates whether the Jump List was modified since the last call to the method.
member.remarks: This property doesn't affect anything. It is for information purpose only.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.RefreshOnStartup
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the Jump List should be refreshed when the program starts up.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.Items
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects that are displayed in the Jump List.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.Tasks
member.summary: Gets the collection of shortcuts (tasks) in the taskbar Jump List.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.KnownCategory
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of a known category to display.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1JumpList.KnownCategoryPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the known category location relative to the custom category collection.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed for the task in the Jump List.
member.remarks: You can visually separate items in a Jump List by creating a that does not have a Title specified. This empty will be displayed as a horizontal line in the Jump List. In this case, other properties can be set, but they will not have any effect.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskbarButton.RegisterFileAssociations(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Registers file associations for the current application.
member.param: A friendly name for the data format, suitable to display to a user.
The path to the default icon, such as, "%systemroot%\system32\imageres.dll,15".
The command and arguments to be used when opening a shortcut to a document, such as, '"C:\Program Files\Paint.NET\PaintDotNet.exe" "%1"'.
The extensions to register, such as '.png'.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskbarButton.RegisterFileAssociations(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Registers file associations for the current application.
member.param: Specifies whether the file associations should be registered in HKEY_CURRENT_USER, not in HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT which requires elevated privileges.
A friendly name for the data format, suitable to display to a user.
The path to the default icon, such as, "%systemroot%\system32\imageres.dll,15".
The command and arguments to be used when opening a shortcut to a document, such as, '"C:\Program Files\Paint.NET\PaintDotNet.exe" "%1"'.
The extensions to register, such as '.png'.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskbarButton.UnregisterFileAssociations(System.String[])
member.summary: Unregisters file associations for the application.
member.param: The extensions to unregister.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskbarButton.UnregisterFileAssociations(System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Unregisters file associations for the application.
member.param: Specifies whether the file associations should be unregistered from HKEY_CURRENT_USER, not from HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT.
The extensions to unregister.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskbarButton.CheckFileAssociations(System.String[])
member.summary: Checks whether the given file extensions are associated with current application.
member.param: The file extensions to check, such as ".txt".
member.returns: Returns True if there is a registered file association for each of the given extensions.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the shortcut is created on the user's Start Menu.

The command-line arguments for a shortcut.

The index of the icon.

member.summary: Gets or sets an icon to use as the overlay. This should be a small icon, measuring 16x16 pixels at 96 dpi.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.Show
member.summary: Creates and shows a task dialog with a default owner.
member.returns: The task dialog result (see also the property).

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.Show(System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.summary: Creates and shows a task dialog.
member.param: An implementation of IWin32Window that will own the task dialog.
member.returns: The task dialog result (see also the property).
member.remarks: You can use the owner parameter to specify a particular object, which implements the IWin32Window interface, that will serve as the dialog box's top-level window and owner. A task dialog is a modal dialog box, which means no input (keyboard or mouse click) can occur except to objects on the modal form. The program must hide or close a modal form (typically in response to some user action) before input to another form can occur.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.Show(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates and shows a task dialog.
member.param: If True, the active window attached to the calling thread's message queue will be the owner for the task dialog.
member.returns: The task dialog result (see also the property).
member.remarks: You can pass False to this method to show the task dialog as an autonomous window.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.ClickButton(C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.TaskDialogCommonButtons)
member.summary: Closes the task dialog by simulating a click on the specified common button.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.ClickButton(C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1CustomButton)
member.summary: Closes the task dialog by simulating a click on the specified .

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.Close
member.summary: Closes the task dialog by simulating a click on the Cancel button.
member.remarks: If the property is set to False and there is no Cancel button in the dialog, the method simulates a click on the Close button.

member.summary: Gets the button or the command link that was clicked in the task dialog and closed it.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets an object that contains additional data about the .

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.CommonButtons
member.summary: Gets or sets the common push buttons displayed in the task dialog.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.CustomButtons
member.summary: Gets the collection of custom buttons displayed in the task dialog.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.RadioButtons
member.summary: Gets the collection of radio buttons displayed in the task dialog.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.EnableHyperlinks
member.summary: Enables hyperlink processing for the dialog strings.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.AllowCancel
member.summary: Indicates that the dialog should be able to be closed using Alt-F4, Escape, and the title bar's close button.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.NoIconOnCommandLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the command links should appear without the default glyph. It doesn't affect whether or not the elevation icons should appear.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.UseCommandLinks
member.summary: Indicates that the buttons specified in the collection should be displayed as command links.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.ExpandFooterArea
member.summary: Indicates that the string specified by the property is displayed at the bottom of the dialog's footer area instead of immediately after the dialog's content.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.ExpandedByDefault
member.summary: Indicates that the string specified by the property is visible when the dialog is initially displayed.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.CheckedByDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the verification check box is checked by default.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.EnableCheckBox
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the verification check box is enabled.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.EnableTimer
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the event is fired approximately every 200 milliseconds.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.StartPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial position of the task dialog.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.RightToLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the task dialog should draw right-to-left for RTL languages.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.CanBeMinimized
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the task dialog can be minimized.
member.remarks: The Minimize button can appear in the caption of the task dialog if you pass false in the 'dialogOwnedByActiveWindow' parameter to the method. It will not appear if the task dialog is owned by the other window.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.SizeToContent
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the width of the task dialog is determined by the width of its content area.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.Width
member.summary: The width of the task dialog's client area. If 0, the task dialog manager will calculate the ideal width.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.ProgressBar
member.summary: Adjusts the progress bar control hosted in the task dialog.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.MainCommonIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined icon to be displayed in the task dialog.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.MainCustomIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom Icon to be displayed in the task dialog.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.FooterCommonIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined icon to be displayed in the footer of the task dialog.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.FooterCustomIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom Icon to be displayed in the footer area of the task dialog.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.WindowTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets the string to be used for the task dialog title.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.MainInstruction
member.summary: Gets or sets the string to be used for the main instruction.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.Content
member.summary: Gets or sets the string to be used for the dialog's primary content.
member.remarks: If the property contains True, then this string may contain hyperlinks in the form: Hyperlink Text.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.CollapsedControlText
member.summary: Gets or sets the string to be used to label the button for expanding the expandable information.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.ExpandedControlText
member.summary: Gets or sets the string to be used to label the button for collapsing the expandable information.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.ExpandedInformation
member.summary: Gets or sets the string to be used for displaying additional information.
member.remarks: If the property contains True, then this string may contain hyperlinks in the form: Hyperlink Text.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.CheckBoxText
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that is used to label the verification check box.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.FooterText
member.summary: Gets or sets the string displayed in the footer area of the task dialog.
member.remarks: If the property contains True, then this string may contain hyperlinks in the form: Hyperlink Text.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.Initialized
member.summary: Occurs before the task dialog is shown.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.Refreshed
member.summary: Occurs after the task dialog is fully refreshed.
member.remarks: It is not possible to update some properties without reconstructing the task dialog. This operation resets the timer counter.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.ExpandedChanged
member.summary: Occurs when a user expands or collapses the task dialog.

member.summary: Occurs when a user clicks a hyperlink.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1TaskDialog.TimerTick
member.summary: Occurs approximately every 200 milliseconds (while the dialog is visible) if the property is set to True.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1ThumbButton.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the thumbnail button's enabled state. If the button is disabled, it is present, but has a visual state that indicates that it will not respond to user action.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1ThumbButton.Interactive
member.summary: Gets or sets the property that describes whether the button is interactive with the user.
member.remarks: Non-interactive buttons don't display any hover behavior nor do they raise click events. They are intended to be used as status icons. This is mostly similar to being not Enabled, but the image is not desaturated.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1ThumbButton.DismissOnClick
member.summary: Gets or sets the property that describes the behavior when the button is clicked. If set to true, the taskbar button's flyout will close immediately.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.C1ThumbButton.NoBackground
member.summary: If set to true, do not draw a button border, use only the image.

member.summary: Gets or sets the button icon, measuring 16x16 pixels at 96 dpi.

member.summary: Gets or sets the index of an image in the ImageList.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image key in the ImageList.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.JumpItemRejectionReason
member.summary: Describes why a could not be added to the Jump List by the Windows shell.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.JumpItemRejectionReason.CustomCategoriesDisabled
member.summary: Custom categories cannot be added while recent documents tracking is turned off.
member.remarks: The recent documents tracking can be changed via: 1. Group Policy Do not keep history of recently opened documents. 2. Via the user setting Store and display recently opened items in the Start menu and the taskbar in the Start menu property dialog.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.JumpItemRejectionReason.InvalidItem
member.summary: The contains incorrect data, for example, references an invalid file path or has no title.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.JumpItemRejectionReason.NoCustomCategory
member.summary: The was not specified.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.JumpItemRejectionReason.NoRegisteredHandler
member.summary: The application is not registered to handle the file name extension of the .
member.remarks: You can use the C1TaskbarButton.RegisterFileAssociations method to register the file associations for an application.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.JumpItemRejectionReason.RemovedByUser
member.summary: The item was previously in the Jump List but was removed by the user.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.JumpListKnownCategory
member.summary: Known category to display in the Jump List.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.JumpListKnownCategory.Neither
member.summary: Don't display either known category. You must have at least one user task or custom category link in order to not see the default 'Recent' known category.

member.summary: Display the 'Recent' known category.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.JumpListKnownCategory.Frequent
member.summary: Display the 'Frequent' known category.

member.summary: The known category location relative to the custom category collection.

member.summary: The known category appears before all custom categories.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Win7Pack.KnownCategoryPosition.AfterCustomCategories
member.summary: The known category appears after all custom categories.
